results.title: Miss Goodall and the wild chimpanzees
results.brief_description: Describes Jane Goodall and her studies as she observes and records the behaviour of wild chimpanzees in a forest reserve near Lake Tanganyika in Africa. Shows the chimpanzees engaged in both individual and social activities. Narrated by Orson Welles

results.title: Miss Australia 1959
results.brief_description: A segment from the 1959 Miss Australia Quest held in Brisbane’s Festival Hall during Queensland’s centenary celebrations. Miss Jean Stanbury of Western Australia is announced as the winner. Miss Australia 1958 is present as one of the judges.

results.title: Misleading cases
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Russell Porter and Michael O'Connell
results.brief_description: A dramatised film of a lecture to medical students. Professor Bruce Kerr shows the ethical dilemma in dealing with cases, of not diagnosing the medical problem correctly. Doctors should look not only at the symptoms presented by the patients but also at their social situation which may also reveal the cause. He points out that medicine is the art of insight into the human condition. (Contains footage of Northcote and University of Melbourne.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Victoria, Russell Porter and Michael O’Connell

results.title: Miserables
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Norman Rosemont and Glenn Jordan
results.brief_description: Victor Hugo’s magnificent tale of the triumph of good over evil is a powerful story of pursuer and pursued. Set in France at the turn of the 18th Century, it follows a handsome young woodcutter, Jean Valjean (Richard Jordan), who is savagely sentenced for stealing a loaf and bears the burden of his guilt throughout his life. Befriended by a Bishop, he vows to lead a life of kindness and morality which he does but he is pursued by the obsessed Police Inspector Javert (Anthony Perkins), over a period of 20 tortured years until Javert commits suicide. Interwoven is a tale of the love between Cossette (Caroline Langrishe), the adopted daughter of Valjean, and Marius (Christopher Guard), who leads a group of insurrectionists against the Republic. The film’s climatic sequence is Government troops assaulting the rebel barricades and the subsequent uniting of the young couple.

results.title: Misconceptions
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Lesley Hammond and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: This film looks at common misconceptions about contraception held by many teenagers. Through a dramatised situation, teenagers are shown that they need not fear being ignorant or misinformed, as sound information is readily and easily available from the Family Planning Association. Contraception is also shown as being the responsibility of both partners.

results.title: Mischief
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Foundation, Ian Shand and Jack Grossman
results.brief_description: At a village pony auction a Davey misses out on buying a pony which was purchased by the owner of a pony trekking stable. He gets a job at the stable looking after the pony ‘Mischief’ leading to the jealousy of other stable hands and his eventual wrongful sacking. When another young boy visiting the stable is thrown from the pony onto a quarry ledge, Davey and ‘Mischief’ try to rescue him before blasting commences at the quarry. Stars: Paul Frazer, Iain Burton, Adrianne Byrne, Michael Newport, Gina Malcolm, Gerald Sim, Colin Gordon, Bill Owen, Frieda Knorr, Charles Rea, Peter Porteous, Deidre Benner and Gerald Williams.

results.title: Mischa
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jennifer Torrance and David Vaisbord
results.brief_description: Director David Vaisbord allows to viewer to share his search to unravel the mystery of his enigmatic Uncle, the violinist Mischa Weisbord. In his prime Mischa was synonymous with fine music, performing throughout Europe and America at the most prestigious venues. In later life Mischa faded into obscurity, a shadow of his former self. When he died he died in poverty, his body laying undiscovered for days because of his reclusive nature. David Vaisbord attempts to reconcile Mischa’s tragic ending to his prolific youth by travelling throughout Europe, Russia, Israel and New York, speaking to family, friends and admirers of the famous musician.

results.title: Miscarriage
results.brief_description: Miscarriage is an extremely common event but for many women it is an unexpected shock from which they may take many years to recover. The sense of failure and feelings of guilt often experienced after a miscarriage can have devastating and influential roles on lives and marriages. This film, co-written by G.P. Dr. Anne McPherson, and sociologist, Ann Oakley, sets out to de-mystify miscarriage through the experiences of women who have had one.

results.title: Mirror, mirror: girls, self esteem & physical activity
results.creator_credit: Adelaide College of TAFE, Gabrielle Kelly and John Gall
results.brief_description: A program for students, parents and teachers on factors affecting the participation of girls and women in physical activity - for example, self esteem, body image, expectations and modelling.

results.title: Mirror of gesture
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Edward Cornachio
results.brief_description: Explores the relationships between two major artistic forms of India - sculpture and dance. Emphasises the artistic correspondences between the two media, but also demonstrates how effectively the rhythms of the dancer have been transformed into sculptural form.
